name: qtip
readme: qtip =========================== pretty, mobile-friendly tooltips. ![screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/z0KmBrE.png) ## demo http://performancejs.com/qtip/demo/ ## features - tiny (.5k gzipped), no dependencies - pretty, stylable via CSS - semantic (augments existing `title` attributes), uses CSS for styling - supported environments: AMD, CommonJS, browser globals ## usage installation is nearly drop-in. just add empty `data-qtip` attributes to any elements with existing `title` attributes that you'd like to style. then attach `qtip.js` to the bottom of your page (it will self-initialize). ```html ... ... ``` ## building it yourself ```bash # install build dependencies npm install # build css stylus stylus --out css # build js grunt ``` ## browser api requirements: - `addEventListener` ([mdn](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget.addEventListener#Browser_compatibility)) - `classList` ([caniuse](http://caniuse.com/#feat=classlist)) - `querySelectorAll` ([caniuse](http://caniuse.com/#search=querySelectorAll))
